thread.title: CHAN: Home Eagles Hold First Training In Burkina Faso
thread.title_full: CHAN: Home Eagles Hold First Training In Burkina Faso

author: Nurudeen Obalola
title: CHAN: Home Eagles Hold First Training In Burkina Faso
text:
Headlines 
By Adeboye Amosu In Ouagadougou: 
The home-based Super Eagles team will hold their first training session at 4pm on Saturday ahead of Sunday’s African Nations Championship qualifier against Burkina Faso. Completesportsnigeria.com was informed on Saturday morning here in Ouagadougou that the team will train at the August 4 stadium at 4pm (5pm Nigerian time). The Eagles landed at the Ouagadougou International Airport at 9.23 pm on Friday night and headed straight for the Palace Hotel, where they will camp for the match. Completesportsnigeria.com arrived in Ouagadougou at the same time with the Eagles and will be providing live updates of all the team’s activities all through their stay here. The Nigerian team defeated Burkina Faso 2-0 in the first leg in Port Harcourt a week ago. The Home Eagles are seeking to qualify for their second straight CHAN after finishing third in South Africa in 2014.
